definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)/surname Yan
to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously/to gorge oneself
to suppress (a sob, harsh words etc)
lit. to swallow one's knocked-out teeth after getting punched in the face (idiom)/fig. to endure bullying or insults stoically
pinyin: da3 diao4 men2 ya2 , wang3 du4 zi5 li3 yan4

sentences.english: She mouthed the drug and then swallowed it reluctantly.
sentences.chinese: 她把藥含在嘴裏，然後勉強地嚥了下去。

sentences.english: Rounds of bread aroma directly toward the muzzle, he energetically the Yanzhao saliva.
sentences.chinese: 一陣陣麪包香味兒直撲鼻口，他使勁的嚥着口水。

sentences.english: He choked back a sharp reply.
sentences.chinese: 他把到了嘴邊的一句刻薄話嚥了回去。

sentences.english: Then I shall swallow it and it will warm my heart.
The cricopharyngeal muscle, a component of the inferior constrictor, forms the muscular orifices of the esophagus.
sentences.chinese: 環狀嚥肌是肌下縮肌中的一個組織，形成食道的肌肉。

sentences.english: The famished old folk could only swallow their tears.
sentences.chinese: 老人們空着肚子得拿眼淚當做水，嚥到肚中去。

sentences.english: Objective To study whether a physical cricopharyngeal bar is related to aging.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究器質性環嚥肌壓跡與老齡化是否有相關性。

sentences.english: I wiped my mouth with the back of my hand, swallowed, and walked toward her.
sentences.chinese: 我用手背擦了擦嘴，嚥了一口唾沫，朝她走過去。

sentences.english: She choked up when she began to talk about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她開始談起母親時，便埂嚥着說不出話來。

sentences.english: I've heard that if you open your mouth and swallow hard, your ears won't pop.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說如果張開嘴，使勁嚥唾沫，耳朵就不會脹痛了。

sentences.english: hope is a good breakfast, but a bad supper.
sentences.chinese: 但願是甘旨的早點，但又是難嚥的晚飯。

definition: variant of 嘗|尝[chang2]/to taste/to experience
to dig out/to pick out (with one's fingers)/to carve/to cut/to study meticulously/to lift one's clothes/stingy/miserly
lit. lips and teeth (idiom); fig. close partners/interdependent
to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously/to gorge oneself
strong-smelling vegetable (garlic etc)/non-vegetarian food (meat, fish etc)/vulgar/obscene
